Package com.hissain.jscipy.signal.fft

Class Spectrogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hissain.jscipy.signal.fft.Spectrogram
  • public class Spectrogram
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of Spectrogram using Short-Time Fourier Transform. Matches scipy.signal.spectrogram behavior.

        public Spectrogram()

    • Method Detail

      • spectrogram

        public SpectrogramResult spectrogram​(double[] x,
                                     double fs)
        Computes a spectrogram with default parameters. Uses nperseg=256, noverlap=128 (half overlap), Hann window, and constant detrending.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        fs - The sampling frequency of the signal in Hz.
        Returns:
        SpectrogramResult containing frequencies, times, and power spectral density.

      • spectrogram

        public SpectrogramResult spectrogram​(double[] x,
                                     double fs,
                                     java.lang.Integer nperseg,
                                     java.lang.Integer noverlap,
                                     java.lang.Integer nfft,
                                     double[] window,
                                     DetrendType detrend)
        Computes a spectrogram of a signal. This implementation matches the behavior of scipy.signal.spectrogram with 'psd' mode.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        fs - The sampling frequency of the signal in Hz.
        nperseg - The length of each segment (window size). Default is 256.
        noverlap - The number of points to overlap between segments. Default is nperseg / 8.
        nfft - The FFT size to use. If null, uses nperseg.
        window - The window function to apply. If null, uses Hann window.
        detrend - The type of detrending to apply to each segment. Default is CONSTANT. Use null for no detrending.
        Returns:
        SpectrogramResult containing frequencies, times, and power spectral density.
